sub_title: Curator Nihon no hanga | Freelance curator / writer / consultant of Japanese art | Het Indo Café
summary: Experienced freelance curator and Japanese art consultant with a demonstrated history of working in the fine art industry. Skilled in Art History, Curating, Social Media, Fine Art, and Museum Collections. Strong arts and design professional with an affinity for 20th century Japanese prints and media.

Meubelstoffeerder, Meubelmaker, Interieuradviseur'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Yin', 'last_name': 'Lauw', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Beleidsadviseur onderwijs, Taal- en Rekencoördinator bij Zadkine, Coach Studentendeelraad HTFB, Excel liefhebber en  Intern Themasessie Consulent'}]}, {'title': 'Collection registrar: Prints donated by Für Elise Foundation at Rijksmuseum Amsterdam', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'description': None, 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Maureen', 'last_name': 'de Vries', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Curator Nihon no hanga | Freelance curator / writer / consultant of Japanese art | Het Indo Café'}]}, {'title': "Exhibition: 'From ukiyo-e to hanga' at Camera Japan Festival", 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'description': 'For a long time, Japanese woodblock prints have intrigued audiences all over the world. Since the 17th century ukiyo-e (lit. images of the floating world) served traditional imagery of Japan. But woodblock printing evolved and by the 20th century, it became known as hanga (lit. printing block/plate picture) because it contained modernistic expressions of contemporary culture. In a chronological overview, this exhibition provides an introduction to the most iconic artists and genres known to this captivating art form.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Maureen', 'last_name': 'de Vries', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Curator Nihon no hanga | Freelance curator / writer / consultant of Japanese art | Het Indo Café'}]}, {'title': "Curator: 'Sōsaku hanga: Creative Prints from Japan | Sōsaku hanga: Creatieve prentkunst uit Japan' at Japanmuseum SieboldHuis", 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'description': "From 17 December 2021 to 13 March 2022 (extended until 29 May 2022) over 140 works of the sōsaku hanga movement will be on display at Japan Museum SieboldHuis in Leiden showcasing the creative autonomy of the Japanese print artists. ‘Sōsaku hanga’ is a must see exhibition for lovers of traditional Japanese prints and connoisseurs of modern art.

Van 17 december 2021 t/m 13 maart 2022 (wegens sluiting verlengd t/m 29 mei 2022) toont Japanmuseum SieboldHuis ‘Sōsaku hanga. Creatieve prentkunst uit Japan’. Zo'n tweehonderd werken van de sōsaku hanga-beweging tonen de ontwikkeling van de ‘creatieve prentkunst’ in Japan. Voor het eerst in Europa wordt er een tentoonstelling gewijd aan deze stroming waarbij de creatieve autonomie van de Japanse prentkunstenaars centraal staat. ‘Sōsaku hanga’ is een must voor zowel liefhebbers van traditionele prenten, als voor kenners van moderne kunst.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Maureen', 'last_name': 'de Vries', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Curator Nihon no hanga | Freelance curator / writer / consultant of Japanese art | Het Indo Café'}]}, {'title': "Registrar: 'One Hundred Aspects of the Moon: Japanese Woodblock Prints by Tsukioka Yoshitoshi' at Museum of East Asian Art Cologne", 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'description': "From September 2020 the Museum of East Asian Art Cologne shows 100 Aspects of the Moon by Tsukioka Yoshitoshi (1839–1892). This exhibition is on view from 17 September 2021 until 9 January 2022.

Yoshitoshi was the last great woodblock print master of the Ukiyo-e tradition, and 100 Aspects of the Moon is regarded as his greatest achievement. The series brings to life the history and mythology of ancient Japan. In all 100 prints the moon figures prominently. Sometimes clearly visible in the design and sometimes referred to in the beautiful poems in the text cartouche.

Yoshitoshi's 100 Aspects of the Moon is very popular among collectors. However, it rarely happens that a complete set in an excellent condition is brought together. The Museum of East Asian Art Cologne will show you one of the finest known sets in the world, which is currently housed in the renowned collection of Japanese print Museum Nihon no Hanga in Amsterdam.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Maureen', 'last_name': 'de Vries', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Curator Nihon no hanga | Freelance curator / writer / consultant of Japanese art | Het Indo Café'}]}, {'title': "Curator: 'Neko. The Cat in Japanese Art | Neko. De kat in Japanse kunst' at Japanmuseum SieboldHuis", 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': "From 31 January 2020 until 5 July 2020 (later extended until 13 September 2020) the exhibition 'Neko. The Cat in Japanese Art' will be on view at Japanmuseum Sieboldhuis in Leiden, the Netherlands. With traditional and contemporary Japanese prints, rare drawings, objects, beautiful scroll paintings and contemporary photography, will show the role of the cat in Japanese art through the centuries.

Van 31 januari 2020 t/m 5 juli 2020 (vanwege sluiting verlengd tot 13 september 2020) toont Japanmuseum SieboldHuis te Leiden de tentoonstelling ‘Neko. De kat in Japanse kunst’. Met traditionele- en hedendaagse Japanse prenten, zeldzame tekeningen, objecten, fraaie rolschilderingen en hedendaagse foto’s wordt de rol van de kat in de Japanse kunst door de eeuwen heen getoond.
", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Maureen', 'last_name': 'de Vries', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Curator Nihon no hanga | Freelance curator / writer / consultant of Japanese art | Het Indo Café'}]}, {'title': 'Yoshitoshi', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'description': 'The Yoshitoshi project involved the creation of a traveling exhibition based on the Edmund Freis Collection of Japanese prints by the major Meiji artist Tsukioka Yoshitoshi (1839-1892). The prints were shown in the Sieboldhuis in Leiden, The Netherlands (9 December 2011 until 18 March 2013) and the Pacific Asia Museum in Pasadena, USA (18 May 2012 until 12 August 2012).', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Amy Reigle', 'last_name': 'Newland', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Independent specialist editor, scholar and writer (Asian art; focus: Japan)'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Chris', 'last_name': 'Uhlenbeck', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Japanese Art Dealer, Freelance Curator and Exhibition Organiser'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Robert Schaap', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Ed Freis', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Maureen', 'last_name': 'de Vries', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Curator Nihon no hanga | Freelance curator / writer / consultant of Japanese art | Het Indo Café'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sytse', 'last_name': 'Boonstra', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Consultant Organisatieontwikkeling - Leiderschap & Teamontwikkeling - Trainer- Coach bij Alliander'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Leon', 'last_name': 'Oninckx', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Art gallery staff member at Hotei Japanese Prints'}]}, {'title': 'Na de aardbeving', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'description': 'Exhibition from the Nihon no hanga collection held at Japanmuseum SieboldHuis in Leiden.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Maureen', 'last_name': 'de Vries', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Curator Nihon no hanga | Freelance curator / writer / consultant of Japanese art | Het Indo Café'}]}]

I have over ten years of curatorial experience, including: researching, compiling and writing publications; developing and producing (international) exhibitions; creating and maintaining databases; collection building, management and preservation; organising cultural activities; hosting lectures and workshops. I also have extensive commercial experience and am available for Japanese art appraisals.

Bokashi means colour gradation and is found in Japanese woodblock prints. The technique is often applied to visually recreate the natural gradient of the changing colours of the sky. Bokashi is eye catching and a beautiful highlight of Japanese prints, found in traditional ukiyo-e as well as 20th century hanga.

Freelance projects: 
Collection registrar: Prints donated by Für Elise Foundation at Rijksmuseum Amsterdam (October 2022 - Present).
Curator: 'Sōsaku hanga. Creative Prints from Japan | Sōsaku hanga. Creatieve prentkunst uit Japan' at Japan Museum SieboldHuis (17 December 2021 - 29 May 2022).
Contributor: 'Moga: Contemporary Beauties in Modern Japanese Prints' in Tokyo: Art & Photography, pp 108-119. Oxford: Ashmolean Museum, 2021.
Curator: 'Neko. The Cat in Japanese Art | Neko. De kat in Japanse kunst' at Japan Museum SieboldHuis (31 January 2020 - 13 September 2020).", 'title': 'Freelance curator, writer, and consultant of Japanese art', 'employment_type': 'Self-employed'}]}, {'company': {'id': 19209584, 'name': 'Nihon no hanga | Japanese Print Collection', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQGI-vtGDMxdOg/company-logo_400_400/0/1621511185299?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=yqe-4pvKkuWA6BUsdKE2Ou2JVpt5QXbUQj4SHAR85jg', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/nihon-no-hanga-japanese-print-collection/', 'employees': {'start': 2, 'end': 10}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Nihon no hanga | Japanese Print Collection', 'description': "Building a collection of 20th century Japanese prints. Conceptualizing, researching, organizing, producing and installing two exhibitions per calendar year. Author of numerous publications. Cataloguing and overall care of the growing collection of 20th century Japanese prints, paintings and illustrated books.
